summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorney Amanda K. Kramer and other individuals (names redacted) from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, discussing scheduling calls related to the Jeffrey Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell case. The emails reference a pre-trial motion opposition deadline, witness interviews, and include an attachment of notes from a February 2016 meeting and a link to a news article about the case.

persons.name: Amanda K. Kramer
persons.context: She is the primary correspondent, scheduling calls regarding the Epstein/Maxwell case, discussing witness interviews and pre-trial motion deadlines.

events.title: Scheduled Call
events.description: A call is scheduled for 10:30 AM between Amanda Kramer and others from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Referenced 2016 Meeting
events.description: Notes from a meeting in February 2016 are referenced and attached to an email, likely related to the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The correspondence involves Assistant U.S. Attorney Amanda K. Kramer from the Southern District of New York working on the Epstein/Maxwell case.
The emails discuss scheduling calls in relation to a pre-trial motion opposition deadline and witness interviews.
An attachment includes notes from a February 2016 meeting, indicating ongoing investigative work referencing past events.
A link to a New York Daily News article about the Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell case is provided in the email chain.
Multiple individuals from the U.S. Attorney's Office are involved in the correspondence, but their names are redacted.
